newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-MURPHY OIL RAISED TO BUY.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-MURPHY OIL RAISED TO BUY.

text.p: JP Morgan analyst Jay Wilson has raised Murphy Oil to "buy" from "market peform".
-- Wilson said in a research report that he has set a 12 month price target for the stock of $63, up from 52-11/16.

-- "It has a rising oil and gas production profile - we forecast production will grow at 14 percent per annum over the next four years, significantly ahead of the five percent growth forecast for its peers," Wilson said.
-- He is forecasting cashflow per share of $9.20 in 1997, $8.95 in 1998 and $11.35 in 1999 and earnings per share of $2.35 in 1997, $2.15 in 1998 and $2.60 in 1999.

-- Estimates are based on West Texas Intermediate prices of $20.25 per barrel in 1997 and $19.00 in 1998 and 1999 and Henry Hub natural gas prices of $2.25 per thousand cubic feet in 1997, $2.10 in 1998 and $2.00 in 1999.
-- Wilson said that he was not including any potential exploration success in his targets, but "any success would be 'gravy' for shareholders". ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
